column4: was using Ubuntu and my electricty went out twice and when I restarted there is no Hard Disk Scan or Error check anything etc like in windows ?
by default ubuntu uses ext3, which recovers gracefully due to journaling
so you mean ext3 is something which takes care of errors & stuff without even running a scandisk sort of thing in front ?
yep, it's the filesystem.  It keeps track of changes and rolls back any that aren't completed
